newsitem.title: USA: Kiwi Int'l in talks with three possible investors.
newsitem.headline: Kiwi Int'l in talks with three possible investors.

text.p: Bankrupt Kiwi International Air Lines remains in talks with three potential investors, after a financing plan with Wasatch International Corp failed, a spokesman said.
Kiwi declined to identify the potential financiers. The airline said it has not been in contact with Wasatch for seven days.
When asked whether Wasatch was out of the running as an investor, Kulat said "that's pretty safe to say."
Last week, Kiwi said Wasatch failed to make the expected payments to Kiwi under the $5 million debtor-in-possession financing agreement.
A federal bankruptcy court judge then gave Kiwi till Friday, November 15 to find alternative financing.
Kiwi is expected to present a new financing plan to the bankruptcy court Friday.
The low-cost carrier sought Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on September 30 and suspended scheduled operations on October 15.
